labels.analysis: The MCP Server "Tako" focuses on real-time data querying and visualization. It allows users to deploy Tako for data search and visualization, upload files for interactive visualizations, and generate visualizations from structured datasets. The core functionality revolves around data visualization and analysis, making it a powerful tool for extracting insights from data in real time.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Data Analysis & Processing" is chosen because the server's tools are centered around data visualization, querying, and interactive reports. The secondary label "Memory Management" is selected due to its ability to handle file uploads and manage these files for visualization purposes. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Tako
server_info_crawled.author: @TakoData/tako-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide real-time data querying and visualization by integrating Tako with your agents. Generate optimized search queries and embed interactive reports seamlessly. Enhance your workflows with live data insights and visualizations from Tako.

tools.name: search_tako
tools.description: Deploy Server @TakoData/tako-mcp Try in Playground search_tako

tools.name: upload_file_to_visualize
tools.description: Upload a file in base64 format to Tako to visualize. Returns the file_id of the uploaded file that can call visualize_file with. Response: file_id: <file_id>

tools.name: visualize_file
tools.description: Visualize a file in Tako using the file_id returned from upload_file_to_visualize. Returns the visualization.

tools.name: visualize_dataset
tools.description: Given a structured dataset in Tako Data Format, return a visualization.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@TakoData/tako-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
